message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper deals with sentiment analysis, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also discusses methods for improving the accuracy of a classifier, which is a common topic in machine learning (cs.LG), and uses feature selection by mutual information, which is a common technique in information retrieval (cs.IR). The paper also mentions the use of n-grams, which is a common technique in both NLP and machine learning. Therefore, it could also be categorized under artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and neural networks (cs.NE).
